Tor,
  See post 437. At first I edited ck2cti, but this did not work in 
the end as other code needed ctbin. So I created ctbin as discussed 
in 437, you have the correct idea. As a windows user I found that I 
needed to make sure ck2cti.exe is in a path that had no spaces in the 
names, thank you Microsoft for such antics. perhaps others know a way 
around that last 'issue'.
- Carl   

--- In cantera@yahoogroups.com, "tortraeland" <torheine@g...> wrote:
> 
> 
> Hey Carl. I just installed cantera 1.5.5 too, and I also ran into
> problems with ctbin.m not being included in the install.
> 
> Did you make your own ctbin.m? Or did you edit ck2cti.m? In either
> case I would be very interested in knowing exactly how you solved 
this
> problem if you did already. From what I understand ctbin should 
return
> a text string pointing to where canteras bin catalogue is.
> 
> Or maybe someone else have any thaughts?
> 
> On beforehands thanks
> 
> -Tor
> 
> 
> 
> --- In cantera@yahoogroups.com, "carlmas20032003"
> <carlmas-20032003@m...> wrote:
> > 
> > 
> > Hey,
> >   I'm a new Cantera user and just installed 1.5.5. It appears 
that 
> > ctbin.m is not included in the install, so one can make it based 
on 
> > an old post or edit code that calls it: ck2cti.m. Thoughts?
> >   Also, I have an error that may have to do with my install as 
others 
> > in my class have not had the same problem with old versions, 
though 
> > this is a repeat of post 449 that got no answer...
> >   Using a ChemKin style input file, with thermo data built in, I 
try 
> > to create an ideal gas and get the following warning and error:
> > 
> > 1) WARNING - I am willing to skip this as it seems minor
> > 
> > **** WARNING ****
> > For species CH3O2H, discontinuity in cp/R detected at Tmid = 1000
> > 	Value computed using low-temperature polynomial:  14.1238.
> > 	Value computed using high-temperature polynomial: 14.1516.
> > 
> > 
> > 2) ERROR - It will not run and this is a repeat from post 449:
> > 
> > ??? Error using ==> Kinetics.Kinetics
> > 
> > 
> > ************************************************
> >                 Cantera Error!                  
> > ************************************************
> > 
> > 
> > Procedure: getRateCoefficient
> > Error:   negative or zero A coefficient for reaction 80
> > 
> > ____________________
> > However, I check out ck2cti.log and reaction 80 reads as follows:
> > reaction 80
> >    CH3O2 + CH3O2 => CH2O + CH3OH + O2
> >    rate coeff:  A, n, E = (1.8E+012, 0, 0)
> > 
> > So A seems okay. Any thoughts?
> > - Carl
